Atmospheric & Oceanic Research

Remote sensing · aerosols & clouds · climate dynamics

Research

We study geophysical fluid dynamics and the Earth system using theory, observations, and numerical models.

Cloud–Aerosol Interactions

Investigation of how aerosols modify cloud microphysics and radiative forcing using satellite retrievals and reanalysis.

Submesoscale Dynamics

Dynamics at 0.1–10 km scales and their role in vertical exchange, productivity, and air–sea interaction.

Remote Sensing Methods

New approaches for multi-sensor fusion and uncertainty quantification for climate data records.

Teaching

  • Atmospheric Physics — Fall. Thermodynamics, radiation, and cloud microphysics.
  • Remote Sensing of the Atmosphere — Spring. Satellite sensors, retrieval algorithms, and validation.
